forecastTestType: Recommended based on minimum interval from invalid dose
generalDescription: This test case describes when dose #1 of a Mening vaccine is administered at 10 years - 1 day and a repeat dose is administered at one month + 25 days later that the dose is considered valid.
reasonForChange:
v1.6: An EIPB clarification has resulted in a change to when dose 2 of MCV should be forecasted and validated.  The second dose must come on or after 16 years (- 4 days) of age to be considered valid.
v1.2: Same test case as previous version rolled younger to allow for the 10 year clarification by NIPInfo
